00040 /* do not leave a zombie, hanging around if possible */
00041 void
00042 let_em_die (int pid)
00043 {
00044   int status;
00045 
00046   waitpid (pid, &status, WNOHANG);
00047 }
00048 
00049 
00050 void
00051 make_em_die (int sig)
00052 {
00053   /* number of times, the sig is sent at most */
00054   int n = 3;
00055 
00056   /* leave if we are session leader */
00057   if (getpgrp () != getpid ())
00058     return;
00059 
00060   /* quickly send siglals and check the result */
00061   if (kill (0, sig) < 0)
00062     return;
00063   let_em_die (0);
00064   if (kill (0, 0) < 0)
00065     return;
00066 
00067   do
00068     {
00069       /* send the signal to everybody in the group */
00070       if (kill (0, sig) < 0)
00071         return;
00072       sleep (1);
00073       /* do not leave a zombie, hanging around if possible */
00074       let_em_die (0);
00075     }
00076   while (--n > 0);
00077 
00078   if (kill (0, 0) < 0)
00079     return;
00080 
00081   kill (0, SIGKILL);
00082   sleep (1);
00083   let_em_die (0);
00084 }

00086 /*
00087  *  Replacement for the signal() function, written
00088  *  by Sagi Zeevi <sagiz@yahoo.com>
00089  */
00090 void (*openvas_signal (int signum, void (*handler) (int))) (int)
00091 {
00092   struct sigaction saNew, saOld;
00093 
00094   /* Init new handler */
00095   sigfillset (&saNew.sa_mask);
00096   sigdelset (&saNew.sa_mask, SIGALRM);  /* make sleep() work */
00097 
00098   saNew.sa_flags = 0;
00099   saNew.sa_handler = handler;
00100 
00101   sigaction (signum, &saNew, &saOld);
00102   return saOld.sa_handler;
00103 }

00114 void
00115 sighandler (int sign)
00116 {
00117   char *sig = NULL;
00118   int murderer = 0;
00119 
00120   switch (sign)
00121     {
00122     case SIGTERM:
00123       sig = "TERM";
00124       murderer++;
00125       pidfile_remove ("openvassd");
00126       break;
00127     case SIGUSR1:
00128       sig = "USR1";
00129       pidfile_remove ("openvassd");
00130       break;
00131     case SIGINT:
00132       sig = "INT";
00133       pidfile_remove ("openvassd");
00134       murderer++;
00135       break;
00136     case SIGSEGV:
00137       signal (SIGSEGV, _exit);
00138       sig = "SEGV";
00139       break;
00140     default:
00141       sig = "< signal nonsense >";
00142     }
00143 
00144   log_write ("received the %s signal\n", sig);
00145 
00146   if (murderer)
00147     make_em_die (sign);
00148 
00149   log_close ();
00150   _exit (0);
00151 }

00154 void
00155 sighand_segv ()
00156 {
00157   signal (SIGSEGV, _exit);
00158   log_write ("SIGSEGV occured !\n");
00159   make_em_die (SIGTERM);
00160   log_close ();
00161   _exit (0);
00162 }
